title: Drawing, "Spoons", 1825–50
medium: Pen, sepia, brush, gray water color
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: At the transition of the bowl into the handle, on the front, is the head of a woman.  The handle is terminating in a herm representing the figure of a woman.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Spoons", 1825–50.
1825–50. Pen, sepia, brush, gray water color. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5490.
